Abraham Lincoln

A Tribute to Mr. Perseverance

Abraham Lincoln - 16th President of the United States

“I am a slow walker, but I never walk back.”

-Abraham Lincoln

Early Failures
Mid-Life Failures
Success
  • 1991: Lost his job & defeated for state legislature
  • 1833: Failed in business
  • 1835: Sweetheart died
  • 1836: Nervous breakdown
  • 1838: Defeated for speaker
  • 1843: Defeated for nomination for Congress
  • 1848: Lost renomination to Congress
  • 1849: Rejected for land officer
  • 1854: Defeated for US Senate
  • 1856: Defeated for nomination for Vice President
  • 1858: Again defeated for U.S. Senate
  • 1860: Elected President of the United States
  • 1862: Signs the Emancipation Proclamation
  • 1864: Wins Re-Election
  • 1865: Confederate Army Surrenders

Learn more about the trials & tribulations of Abraham Lincoln on his wikipedia page
